Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class FileUtil
extends Object
    File Utilities to assist in File I/O

      • openOutputFile

        public static PrintStream openOutputFile(String fname)
                                  throws Exception
        returns a PrintStream object using the passed String filename. Must check if file already exists, and prompt for overwrite if it does. Turns on AutoFlush.
        Parameters:
        fname - Filename to be opened for writing
        Returns:
        number of lines in the file
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of error, let calling method handle it.

      • openOutputFile

        public static PrintStream openOutputFile(File file)
                                  throws Exception
        returns a PrintStream object using the passed File object. Must check if file already exists, and prompt for overwrite if it does. Turns on AutoFlush.

        file - Filename to be opened for writing
        Returns:
        PrintStream suitable for writing
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of error, let calling method handle it.

      • openOutputFile

        public static PrintStream openOutputFile()
                                  throws Exception
        returns a PrintStream object created by prompting (and, if necessary, re-prompting) the user for a valid filename. Must check if file already exists, and prompt for overwrite if it does. Turns on AutoFlush
        Returns:
        PrintStream suitable for writing
        Throws:
        Exception - in case of error, let calling method handle it.
